statement.p: Pollsters are concerned about declining levels of cooperation among persons contacted in surveys. A pollster contacts 101 people in the 18-21 age bracket and finds that 86 of them respond and 15 refuse to respond. When 258 people in the 22-29 age bracket are contacted, 235 respond and 23 refuse to respond. Assume that 1 of the 359 people is randomly selected. Find the probability of getting someone in the 18-21 age bracket OR someone who refused to respond.
Report the answer as a percent rounded to one decimal place accuracy. You need not enter the "" symbol.
